==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=黄门}}

===Etymology===
Established during the [[w:Qin Dynasty|Qin]] and [[w:Han Dynasty|Han]] Dynasties, the name was changed to [[門下省]] after the [[w:Jin Dynasty|Jin Dynasty]]. Responsible for [[proofreading]] imperial edicts which were drafted in the name of the emperor.

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=huángmén
|cat=n
}}

===Noun===
{{zh-noun}}

# {{lb|zh|archaic}} [[w:Three Departments and Six Ministries|Edict Examination Bureau]] ([[門下省]])
# {{lb|zh|archaic}} a [[eunuch]]

===Usage notes===
During the [[w:Han Dynasty|Eastern Han Dynasty]], this position was filled exclusively by eunuchs. As a result, 黃門 eventually became another word for [[eunuch]].
